Unless you're using checkpoints, you can always delete the .DEL files. 
(If using checkpointing, make sure to retain the .DEL files representing 
.JDB files referenced by the checkpoints you might want to resume from 
-- perhaps just the last checkpoint.)

- Gordon @ IA

On 12/12/10 11:13 PM, Mahmoud Mubarak wrote:
>
> I have a concern for growing disk usage on my job's directory, and I am
> worried the crawl would stall due to the file system running out of
> space. Would it be a good idea to get rid of the .del files under the
> state directory while the crawl is running, or would it be better to
> take a different approach?
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
